abstract: A record of the data that a particular website stores persistently.
overview:
## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataRecord] objects to discover the types of information that a website stores. Records identify the data types a website stores, but don’t identify the actual data. You might use this information to help the user manage website data. For example, Safari provides a way for users to view and remove website data. The domain name of each record contains the website’s domain name and suffix.

You don’t create [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataRecord] objects directly. WebKit creates these records and stores them in the web view’s data store. Use the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore/fetchDataRecords(ofTypes:completionHandler:)] of that data store to retrieve the current record objects. You also use that object to remove unwanted records.

# WKWebsiteDataRecord

**Class**

A record of the data that a particular website stores persistently.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class WKWebsiteDataRecord
```

## Overview

Use [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataRecord] objects to discover the types of information that a website stores. Records identify the data types a website stores, but don’t identify the actual data. You might use this information to help the user manage website data. For example, Safari provides a way for users to view and remove website data. The domain name of each record contains the website’s domain name and suffix.

You don’t create [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataRecord] objects directly. WebKit creates these records and stores them in the web view’s data store. Use the [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebsiteDataStore/fetchDataRecords(ofTypes:completionHandler:)] of that data store to retrieve the current record objects. You also use that object to remove unwanted records.

## Getting the Record Information

- **displayName**: The display name for the data record.

## Getting the Data Type

- **dataTypes**: The types of data associated with the record.
- **Data Store Record Types**: Explore the constants that identify the types of data that websites store.

## Web data management

- **WKWebsiteDataStore**: An object that manages cookies, disk and memory caches, and other types of data for a web view.
- **WKHTTPCookieStore**: An object that manages the HTTP cookies associated with a particular web view.
- **WKURLSchemeHandler**: A protocol for loading resources with URL schemes that WebKit doesn’t handle.
- **WKURLSchemeTask**: An interface that WebKit uses to request custom resources from your app.
- **readAccessURL**: The local files WebKit can access when loading content.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
- Sendable
